channel.title: the Rails Camp Project on Failure Driven
channel.description: Recent content in the Rails Camp Project on Failure Driven

item.title: Navigate to First Round
item.description: Tim is next up in our series of “code with everyone at rails camp Hobart project”. As is part of the process in TDD, we were now ready for some refactoring in the GREEN.

item.title: Round 1 to a conversation
item.description: Pairing whilst coding is a lot about the social interaction. This next commit of “The Rails Camp Project” was less about a test for Round 1 and more about the conversation.

item.title: Start the Game with React
item.description: Happy to join us for a commit on our mission to pair with everyone as part of “The Rails Camp Project”, at Rails Camp Hobart, was Rob Jacoby.

item.title: Pending Specs for Continuous Integration
item.description: Happy to join us for a commit on our mission to pair with everyone as part of “The Rails Camp Project”, at Rails Camp Hobart, we were excited to be coding next with Brenton!

item.title: Is snapshot testing test driven?
item.description: In our endeavour to pair with everyone as part of “The Rails Camp Project”, at Rails Camp Hobart, our next pair was Emily.

item.title: The first line of code in a Rails app shoud be ...
item.description: As part of “The Rails Camp Project”, coding with everyone at rails camp to build a simple game in Rails and ReactJS, it was time to write the first line of code.

item.title: Rails New

item.title: Autofocus text area
item.description: Although there was a lot of support for our “The Rails Camp Project”, at Rails Camp Hobart, there was not always support for our practices of pairing and testing.

item.title: Commit 19 Refactor React Dumb Component to Class
item.description: Chris joined us for a little refactor as part of rails camp Hobart pairing project. It was time to make a dumb component in React have a little bit more functionality and we first needed to change it to a class.

item.title: Commit 18 Placeholder for Status
item.description: TODO what do we write to introduce this? it is just another simple JS test and implementation Commit 005a20e

item.title: Commit 17 Pending Status
item.description: Bashir was another learning developer from Coder Academy and we spent some time showing him the in’s and out’s of a tested rails app as part of our rails camp Hobart project.

item.title: Commit 16 Add Text Area
item.description: It is tough getting up on a Sunday any week let alone at Rails Camp let alone if you have had a long night the night before.

item.title: Commit 15 Pending Text Area
item.description: By the time we caught up with Nick to help us with our rails camp Hobart project, it was more like him tracking us down for a final commit in the wee hours of Sunday morning.

item.title: Commit 14 Render Images
item.description: Having followed along with Cameo on the introduction to our rails camp Hobart project, seeing all the tests pass, our next commrade Ethan was already up to speed with what was going on.

item.title: Commit 13 Test for Images
item.description: Cameo: “What time is it?” We were digging deep now at rails camp Hobart at 2 oclock in the morning!

item.title: Commit 12 Expect Images
item.description: Starting to get well into the middle of the night at rails camp Hobart and we still didn’t have an image displayed in our app!

item.title: Commit 11 React Router
item.description: The whole point of our code with everyone at rails camp Hobart project was to code with, well everyone but sometimes you just need to stick it out with the core team.
